poem:
Title: In Ashen Echoes

Civil strife, born of nameless discord, yields
An apathetic landscape of shattered ideals.
Smoky spectres rise from CGI grotesques,
Silhouettes of power, burnt husks of progress.
In the distant haze, mere extras we become,
Lying strewn, lost voices with no anthem.
A spectacle, you say? Evading politics,
Yet silent commentary burns as ghastly pyrexics. 
Someday perhaps, the issues we'll unmask,
Till then, we enjoy the firework's vast expanse.
